alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 05 at 4:10PM AKST until February 05 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Visibility reduced to one half mile at times, locally down to one quarter mile at times near Portage Lake. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches with locally higher amounts up to 20 inches possible near the Whittier tunnel. Winds 25 mph gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Turnagain Pass and the Portage Valley. * WHEN...From 9 AM to 9 PM AKST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Travel will be difficult. Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Towards the end of the advisory period, temperatures may rise to near or above freezing, allowing rain to mix with snow in Portage Valley. Drifting snow is possible on roadways. The winds will slowly decrease by Sunday evening, however, the snow will continue through Monday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
